name: agTrend
tagline: R package for Bayesian inference of trends for aggregated abundance surveys
body:
### Welcome to agTrend.
This is the future home of the R package *agTrend* for Bayesian inference of trends for aggregated survey data

#### Installing *agTrend*

There are two basic methods to install the agTrend package, from within R itself using the devtools package and downloading a binary appropriate to your operating system. If you are using a windows machine it is possible that you will need [Rtools](http://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/Rtools/) installed to build and install the package. There is no compiled code in agTrend. 

*Using devtools*

You can obtain the agTrend package using the GitHub installation function within the devtools R package. If devtools is not installed, it can be installed from CRAN by typing `install.packages("devtools")` from within the R console.

If devtools is installed, to install agTrend, open the R console and type
```
> library(devtools)
> install_github("agTrend", username="NMML")
```

After which you should see something like the following output

```
Installing github repo(s) agTrend/master from NMML
Installing agTrend.zip from https://github.com/NMML/agTrend/archive/master.zip
Installing agTrend
'/Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Resources/bin/R' --vanilla CMD build  \
  '/private/var/folders/6k/w2252zws24q227kr94cd0k7w000595/T/RtmpF5155F/agTrend-master'  \
  --no-manual --no-resave-data 

* checking for file '/private/var/folders/6k/w2252zws24q227kr94cd0k7w000595/T/RtmpF5155F/agTrend-master/DESCRIPTION' ... OK
* preparing 'agTrend':
* checking DESCRIPTION meta-information ... OK
* checking for LF line-endings in source and make files
* checking for empty or unneeded directories
* looking to see if a 'data/datalist' file should be added
* building 'agTrend_0.11.tar.gz'

'/Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Resources/bin/R' --vanilla CMD INSTALL  \
  '/var/folders/6k/w2252zws24q227kr94cd0k7w000595/T//RtmpF5155F/agTrend_0.11.tar.gz'  \
  --library='/Users/devin.johnson@afsc.noaa.gov/Library/R' --with-keep.source 

* installing *source* package 'agTrend' ...
** R
** data
** demo
** inst
** preparing package for lazy loading
** help
*** installing help indices
** building package indices
** testing if installed package can be loaded
* DONE (agTrend)
```


*Downloading a binary file*

I have also placed copies of the binary installation files in a Google drive. Follow the following links for your operating system: [Mac OSX](https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B7NE3XGvDquOblh1YmRsSEVCTFk/edit?usp=sharing) or [Windows](). If you are running a Linux machine, see the following section. *Note*: make sure your browser does not try to automatically unpack the file (this is the default for Safari, go into preferences to change this feature). 

After you download the file, open R and set the working directory (e.g., using `setwd("path/to/download/dir/")`). Once this is set, run

```
>install.packages("agTrend.zip", repos=NULL)
```
If you have a mac replace with "agTrend.zip" with "agTrend.tgz".

*Downloading the source file*
Source files for each version can be obtained [here](https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0B7NE3XGvDquORXpfb05xMWw2SHc&usp=sharing). The desired file can be downloaded and installed in the same way as with the binaries, replacing the file name.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
